The activity you’re describing is most closely related to “Prepare the change control approach”. This process involves setting up a system for managing changes to the project, such as new user requirements. These changes are only implemented if they are given a “must have” priority and approved by an executive.

questions.question_text:
ABC Company has decided to include the Health and Safety Training Project in a programme to support their strategy to deliver globally. The programme team has provided the detailed business justification and, as a result, the project board has decided that the business case will not need refining further during the
'initiating a project' process.
Is this an appropriate action for the project board, and why?

At the end of stage 2, the specialist 'e-learning course' supplier will be selected. As a result, it is decided that the quality management approach will not be created until the end of stage 2, to take into account this supplier's standards and techniques.
Is this appropriate, and why?

discussion.content:
The answer is C. No, because the quality management approach should be created during the initiation stage and updated later.

In project management, it’s important to establish a quality management approach early on. This approach outlines the organization’s quality expectations, standards, and processes that will be used throughout the project. It provides a framework for ensuring that the project’s outputs meet the required standards and deliver value to the stakeholders.

choices.A: Yes, because the quality management approach should take into account the supplier's standards, tools and techniques.
choices.B: Yes, because the product description for each product will define the required quality approach within each stage.
choices.D: No, because the quality management approach should be limited to ABC Company's quality standards.
choices.C: No, because the quality management approach should be created during the initiation stage and updated later.

Selected Answer: D
The correct option is D. 
The wording of the option is bit misleading. It is the benefit of the ABC company only that should be used to justify the project business case.

The executive identified that there would be a benefit to the construction companies as their working time lost due to accidents would be reduced. This was included as a benefit to ABC Company in the business case for the Health and Safety Training Project.
Is this appropriate, and why?
A. Yes, because the benefits to the customer are an essential part of business justification for a project.
B. Yes, because both tangible and intangible benefits should be included in the business case.
C. No, because ABC Company will not achieve their benefits if construction companies do not book the courses.
D. No, because it is the customer's benefits that should be used to justify the project business case.

comments.content: Agreed with Manik. The benefits to the customer (construction companies) should not be included in the business case justification for the training company (ABC). The business case should focus on the expected benefits that the training company itself hopes to achieve by doing the project.
